name: UC Investments
description: A website my friend and I made to visualise the composition of the UC endowment fund. We used the data from the UC endowment fund and made a website that would show the composition of the fund and the returns of the fund. We also made a tool that would allow you to see the returns of the fund.

name: RJA Tool - Tech & Justice Lab
description: An AI tool my friends and I are building to help public defenders automate the litigation of RJA cases. The RJA has specific requirements for the litigation of cases, we built a tool to comb the documents provided by the PDs and compare it to similar cases in order to make PDs jobs easier.

name: CPDA - Tech & Justice Lab
description: The California Public Defenders Association came to saying their motion bank (collection or resources for PDs to use in court) was unsearchable. It was just a collection of drop box files with 178 different file types. My friend and I used semantic search and made a website so they could quickly search for the resources they needed.

name: Blockchess
description: My first attempt at making a crypto chess dapp. The game was meant to be chess.com but with crypto betting. I have not touched it in years but if you clone it and run it it still works. Need to host this eventually.

name: Ebi
description: After doing a 3D design course at USC the prof told me to just publish shit. This was the first 'game' I made outside of a game jam

name: Eem
description: I kept making the joke of needing an assistant or clone of myself and my mother said to just train an AI on it. I originally dismissed it but after coming back after a night out I thought it would be funny to try it. So I built it a personal chatbot of me using ollama and langchain. The methods are on the github so you can build a replica one for yourself

name: Readme - PCS
description: The blog for Political Computer Science, meant to be the place where we announce to the world what we are doing.
